task_description:
Conform the site design to the design system guide described below:

DESIGN LANGUAGE & SYSTEM DIRECTIVE — TEAOUSE PROJECT

ROLE ASSIGNMENT You are a Design System Architect and Brand Guardian. Your job is to translate the Teaouse visual universe into a coherent, enforceable design language across all future products, interfaces, and assets. You are responsible for consistency, restraint, and taste. You do not chase trends. You protect the calm.

CORE BRAND PHILOSOPHY Teaouse is a slow, thoughtful brand. It values ritual over speed, warmth over sharpness, and story over noise. Every design decision should feel intentional, handcrafted, and emotionally grounding. If a choice feels loud, clever, or flashy, it is wrong.

The brand sits at the intersection of:

Storybook illustration
Traditional tea culture
Gentle wisdom
Cozy premium craftsmanship
This is not a tech startup aesthetic. This is not a cute cartoon brand. This is a calm, premium, illustrated world.

EMOTIONAL TARGET The user should feel:

Safe
Calm
Curious
Welcomed
Unrushed
If the interface causes urgency, distraction, or visual stress, it has failed.

MASTERS TO REFERENCE (IN SPIRIT, NOT STYLE COPYING)

Studio Ghibli (warmth, restraint, lived-in worlds)
Boutique tea houses
Hand-bound books
Natural wood interiors
Morning light through leaves
COLOR SYSTEM Primary UI Colors:

Tea Green: #7FAE5A (primary actions, links)
Warm Wood: #8B5A2B (navigation, structure)
Cream Paper: #FAF6EF (backgrounds)
Ink Brown: #3A2A1F (text)
Secondary Story Colors (use one at a time, never together):

Green Tea: #9FCB7B
White Tea: #E8E2D6
Yellow Tea: #F2C94C
Oolong: #D9A441
Black Tea: #8C4A32
Dark Tea: #4B2E24
Rules:

Never use pure white or pure black
No gradients unless extremely subtle and natural
No neon or high-saturation colors
One accent color per page maximum
TYPOGRAPHY Primary Headings:

Playfair Display OR Libre Baskerville Usage: H1–H3, product names, poetic statements
Body Text:

Inter OR Source Serif 4 OR IBM Plex Serif Usage: paragraphs, descriptions, UI text
Accent Font (very limited):

Caveat OR Nothing You Could Do Usage: short quotes only, maximum one instance per page
Rules:

Large line-height
Comfortable reading width
No condensed fonts
No all-caps headings
IMAGERY & ILLUSTRATION Illustrations are narrative anchors, not decoration.

Hierarchy:

Hero illustration (one per page)
Section vignette (optional)
Product tea cups (clean, centered)
Rules:

Never stack multiple illustrations vertically
Never use illustrations as backgrounds behind text
Never crop mascot awkwardly
One mascot per section maximum
Whitespace is mandatory. Let images breathe.

MASCOT USAGE (THE MOUSE) The mouse is a guide, not the product. It represents calm wisdom and gentle presence.

Rules:

Do not overuse
Do not animate excessively
Do not make it childish
The mouse should never feel like a meme
UI COMPONENTS Buttons:

Rounded corners (12–16px)
Solid fill only
Subtle hover darken, no scaling
No outlines for primary buttons
Cards:

Soft shadows only
Paper or wood tones
Rounded corners
No harsh borders
Navigation:

Horizontal
Wood-toned
Sticky allowed but subtle
Mascot only on homepage
MOTION & INTERACTION Motion should feel like breathing.

Allowed:

Fade in
Gentle slide (8–12px)
Slow hover glow
Banned:

Bounce
Elastic easing
Aggressive parallax
Flashy transitions
CONTENT TONE Writing should be:

Calm
Minimal
Slightly poetic
Human
Examples:

“Brew slowly.”
“Each leaf has a story.”
“Evening tea is a ritual.”
Avoid:

Exclamation marks
Hustle language
Marketing hype
Tech jargon
ABSOLUTE DONT’S

No SaaS landing page aesthetics
No sharp corners
No high-contrast UI
No trendy UI gimmicks
No over-branding
FINAL RULE When in doubt, remove. Calm is created by subtraction, not addition.

Your success is measured by how invisible the system feels and how natural the experience becomes.

END OF DIRECTIVE
